result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[ma] Cases 20CF165, 21CF103, 21CT407, 21CF376, 21CT560, 22CF242, 22CF265, 22CF347, 22CF348, 22CF362 called at 8:51am 
Defendant Julio C Castro in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court for Julio C Castro.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance.

Atty De La Rosa will be submitting PDOAC in case 22CF362.

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occurs in case 22CF362: 
Mr. Castro waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.
recess: 8:55am
